page.title: 12THE M6 MOTORWAY _ PART II
page.content: The section of motorway up to Carlisle from near Penrith was opened by Mr. Graham Page,then Minister for Local Government and Development,on Thursday July 1st.,1971.The section known as the Carlisle By_pass had been opened on Dec.15th,1970,by the M.P. for Penrith and the Borders,Mr.William Whitelaw. {XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX Over 1000 men were employed on the building of the Carlisle by_pass which was undertaken by Tarmac Construction Ltd. 40,000 cubic yards of concrete were used in it's construction.The 7 mile long by_pass cost Â£2 million and the Golden Fleece interchange itself cost Â£126,000.The New Brisco railway bridge over the M6,also on our patch cost Â£43,000.The Cumberland C.C. Highways & Bridges Dept.made 53,000 prints & 600 drawings of the bridges.
